etymology.description: 人民 (people) + 币/幣 (currency) = people's currency (PRC currency).
etymology.interpretation: Names the national currency of the People's Republic of China; in daily use it often refers to 元 (yuán) as a unit. Conveys an official, state-backed currency of the people.
etymology.simplification: 幣 was simplified to 币 in the PRC to reduce strokes during mid-20th-century script reforms; 人民 remained unchanged.

parts.english: the people; citizenry; populace; common people

examples.chinese: 我用人民币付款(我用人民幣付款)。
这家商店只收人民币(這家商店只收人民幣)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā shāngdiàn zhǐ shōu Rénmínbì.

examples.chinese: 人民币兑美元的汇率今天上升了(人民幣兌美元的匯率今天上升了)。
examples.pinyin: Rénmínbì duì Měiyuán de huìlǜ jīntiān shàngshēng le.
examples.english: The RMB exchange rate against the U.S. dollar rose today.
